meanings.definition: Of or relating to a time or society before the development of writing.
meanings.sent1: The ancient cave paintings are a preliterate form of communication.
meanings.sent2: The preliterate cultures relied on oral traditions to pass down stories.
meanings.sent3: In the preliterate world, people used symbols and drawings to convey messages.
meanings.sent4: The preliterate era was filled with spoken myths and legends.
meanings.sent5: The preliterate societies had rich oral histories.

meanings.definition: A person who has not yet learned to read or write.
meanings.sent1: The teacher worked patiently with the preliterate child to teach basic literacy skills.
meanings.sent2: In some remote areas, there are preliterate individuals who have not had access to formal education.
meanings.sent3: The preliterate student was eager to learn the alphabet and start reading.
meanings.sent4: The preliterate adult found joy in discovering the world of books and writing.
meanings.sent5: The preliterate population benefited from literacy programs in the community.
